intro: Lychnis cyrillii, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple, blooming in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
